intro: Didyplosandra bolumpattiana, commonly known as the Bolumpatti sandalwood, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the tropical rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Santalaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and fragrant, often appearing in clusters, and it produces small, woody fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
